silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extracts of the fruiting bodies of pleurotus eryngii and flammulina velutipes led to the isolation of ergosterol, trilinolein, triacylglycerols, . the nmr spectra of ergosterol, are in accordance with data reported in the literature for ergosterol; trilinolein, for trilinolein; and triacylglycerols, for triacylglycerol.
the 30% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed triacylglycerols, ) using 15% etoac in petroleum ether to yield ergosterol, (5 mg) after washing with petroleum ether..
the 30% acetone in ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed trilinolein, ) using 15% etoac in petroleum ether to yield ergosterol, (9 mg) after washing with petroleum ether.
the ch2cl2 fraction was rechromatographed trilinolein, ) using 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford trilinolein, (6 mg).
the ch2cl2 to 20% acetone in dichloromethane fractions were combined and rechromatographed trilinolein, ) using 5% etoac in petroleum ether to afford triacylglycerols, (7 mg).
the crude extracts were fractionated by silica gel chromatography using increasing proportions of acetone in ch2cl2 (10%increment) as eluents.
the ethanol extract of p. eryngii afforded ergosterol peroxide which is an inhibitor of osteoclast differentiation.

the fatty acids attached to the glycerol in triacylglycerols, of f. velutipes were identified as linolenic acid, linoleic acid and oleic acid based on resonance intensities for the methyl triplet at 0.96 (t, j = 7. hz), the double allylic methylenes at trilinolein, 78 and the olefinic protons at 5.34 (m) for the linolenic acid; methyl triplet at 0.86 (t, j = 6. hz), the double allylic methylene at trilinolein, 80 and the olefinic protons at 5.34 (m) for the linoleic acid; and the methyl triplet at 0.86 (t, j = 6. hz) and the olefinic protons at 5.34 (m) for the oleic acid.
